newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean feed millers buy 52,500 T of U.S. corn.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean feed millers buy 52,500 T of U.S. corn.

text.p: South Korean feed mill companies, including Miwon Co Ltd, Woo Sung Feed Mill Co Ltd and Purina Korea on Tuesday bought 52,500 tonnes of U.S. No.3 yellow corn from Japanese trading house Mitsubishi, traders said.

Traders said the feed mill companies bought the corn at 87.95 cent per bushel basis over March futures on the Chicago Board of Trade if from the Pacific Northwest or at 85.95 cent basis over CBOT's March futures if from the U.S. Gulf.
Shipment was set on seller's option for February 14-March 5 if from the Pacific Northwest or for February 1-20 if from the U.S. Gulf.
Arrival was slated for March 20 to the western port cities of Inchon and Kunsan.
